column4: and if the number doesnt match then you need to re-download the iso.. highlu this isnt the case, but to be sure this is always a first step..
i'm actually on a ubuntu usb.. so it does work from usb
it doesnt work for me on that computer
does the install load? or does the install install but you cant boot the "installed" ?
i installed ubuntu 10.10 on it before, but now i can't get to the installation startup for 12.04 server, but it takes the installation cd for 10.10
so no, it doesnt load installer
the 12.04 installer does not boot for both as a usbinstaller or cdinstaller ?
nope
did you md5 checksum the iso?
no
never done that before
http://releases.ubuntu.com/12.04/
(this too https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HowToMD5SUM)
a unique math number is made from any file.. this number has to match the reported checksum from MD5SUMS
the md5sum matched the one on the site
that's good
so its either the install media or something else..
did you try  boot options with the installer?
how do you mean?
try acpi=off or nomodeset--  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BootOptions
how do i edit the grub file manually then, since it just starts the OS everytime instead of the other two that should start first?
where can i find the grub.cfg file in the iso then? cause its not in /boot/grub/

you edit grub rules in /etc/default and /etc/grubxxxx/   .. then do update-grub2  -- this updates grub.cfg somewhere in /boot ... the grub1-2 stage loader looks for grub.cfg .. -- don't edit grub.cfg directly because you'll lose changes when you update kernel packages
where in the grub file do i put acpi=off ? cause i see that all of them have a GRUB_ prefix, so i am a bit confused now
